page.title: 09HORTICULTURE
page.content: Despite the short summers,high altitude and severe winter conditions, {vegetables and fruit}are often home-grown for home consumption- tomatoes,leeks,peas,cabbage,caulifour, broccoli,cucumber,onions,parsnips, beans(runner,french,broad),potatoes, carrots,brussel sprouts,salad and root crops. Surpluses are exchanged,frozen, or preserved as jams or pickles.The {Leek Club}with its annual Show is an important village event. {Local fruit}include cherries,plums, gooseberries,strawberries,currants, raspberries,apples and pears. Commonly used{herbs}are mint,parsley sage and chives.Hedgerow plants may be gathered.{Bees}are often kept. Many use a greenhouse or cold frame to prolong the growing season. High stone walls give protection to gardens. A well-kept garden= virtuous character.
